Biogen shares tumbled after Medicare said it would limit coverage of its controversial $28,000 Alzheimer’s drug, Aduhelm.</span>
</li>

Then, cases are expected to plummet “simply because everybody who could be infected will be infected,” Washington professor Ali Mokdad told the AP. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/cpi-inflation-2021-december?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Live Look at Consumer Prices
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/cpi-inflation-2021-december?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="A still from the movie Up" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/926f80cb514dde396a171eda62036b2ba2d9c943-1920x1080.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Pixar </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You all selected inflation as the top business story of 2021, and it just kicked off its 2022 campaign with a bang. Consumer prices <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-business-consumer-prices-economy-5f69bed77f98221f9936ae99f96fd361?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soared 7%</a> in December, marking the largest yearly increase since 1982, the Labor Department reported yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The biggest culprits: </strong>Shelter costs (aka rent) and used car prices.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Shelter costs</strong></span><span> jumped 0.4% from the previous month and 4.1% on the year—their fastest annual growth since February 2007.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Used vehicles</strong></span><span>, which have become the poster child for the current inflationary environment, have increased 37% over the past year.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Gasoline prices</strong></span><span> have also spiked nearly 50% since December 2020, though fuel and energy costs dipped slightly last month.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And while many Americans have gotten a raise this year, pay bumps haven’t kept up with price bumps. Real average hourly earnings, or wages that take inflation into account, fell a seasonally adjusted 2.4% in December from a year earlier.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">What can be done?</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s start with the Fed, whose literal job is to keep prices under control. Caught flat-footed as inflation spread across the economy, the central bank is now planning to wind down its stimulus measures and hike interest rates several times this year. The point is that higher interest rates raise borrowing costs for consumers and businesses, slowing down demand, incentivizing more saving, and in turn deflating prices.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Other ideas: </strong></span><span>The Biden administration has launched an antitrust crusade against highly concentrated industries in the hopes more competition will bring down prices. And the US Chamber of Commerce argued for more immigration to ease labor shortages.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But some analysts argue many of those interventions are like giving Gatorade to a hungover 40 year old—the only fix is to just wait it out. That’s because the Covid-related supply-chain bottlenecks that helped fuel inflation are still raging, and prices will only start to cool when constrained supply catches up with demand.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Those bottlenecks could get even worse. Manufacturing powerhouse China has locked down roughly 20 million people across three cities in a bid to prevent a widespread Omicron outbreak. HSBC economists warned that the Big O gaining steam in Asia, where it hasn’t taken off yet, could lead to the “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2022-01-12/supply-chain-latest-china-s-covid-fight-risks-more-supply-turmoil?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mother of all</a>” supply chain disruptions by forcing factories offline…again.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/boris-johnson-apologizes-covid-party?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Boris Is Sorry for Party Rocking
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/boris-johnson-apologizes-covid-party?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Boris Johnson speaks to House of Commons" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0a38661c2643481d738171af43e57bf8d46b4671-1920x1080.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>House Of Commons - PA Images/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lady Whistledown would have a field day with Boris Johnson’s latest scandal. The UK prime minister <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-europe-london-2b9b4147b1ee8041b341dfce5ef92208?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apologized</a> yesterday for attending a large outdoor party during Britain's first Covid lockdown in 2020. But his mea culpa did little to douse a political firestorm—officials in every major UK political party, even his own, are urging Johnson to resign.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>On May 22, 2020, a senior official for Johnson organized a BYOB outdoor garden gathering. Johnson said he only showed up to thank staff for their work throughout the pandemic, so he considered it a “work event.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At that time, UK citizens were only </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-59577129?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allowed</a></span><span> to meet one other person outside their own household, and they had to be outdoors and remain two meters apart.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So you can probably understand why Brits were so mad to find out politicians were schmoozing among the tulips. The budget airline Ryanair—which isn’t new to trolling the prime minister—let its social media team go hog wild and <a href="https://twitter.com/Ryanair/status/1481238702013796352?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roast</a> Johnson with memes so good we thought <em>we</em> made them. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>A handful of government officials around the world have treated their own Covid guidelines like they’re a “hand wash only” tag. Last month, for instance, Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin was caught dancing maskless at a club a day after she was in contact with someone who tested positive.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/cdc-may-recommend-n95-over-cloth-masks?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Cloth Masks, You Were S’cute<br>
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/cdc-may-recommend-n95-over-cloth-masks?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Kaleidoscope of masks" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e22e9aee0a790ee6dcfafe26fd442d9d92f4a15d-1500x1000.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Photo Illustration: Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Source: Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The CDC could soon change its masking recommendation from “fabric/surgical masks are fine” to “time to stock up on N95s,” the Washington Post reported. The possible switch follows several new studies that suggest cloth <a href="https://www.axios.com/n95-mask-protection-covid-958039c9-07f1-45a1-81e7-b7436707fee5.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t cutting it</a> anymore.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In one, a well-fit N95 (or other particle-filtering mask) was found to be 75x better at preventing Covid-19 than a surgical mask.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bad news for <em>Hey Arnold!</em>: The most important factor in recent mask studies was how well it fits. People wearing snug N95s were protected against Covid for 2,500 hours if the infected person also wore a fitted N95, versus 25 hours with non-fit-tested N95s.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The growing recognition that N95 > cloth and the possibility of new CDC guidance have caused the prices of N95 and KN95 masks <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-12/n95-kn95-or-cloth-masks-prices-surge-as-cdc-weighs-new-recommendations?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to spike</a>, with some brands nearly quintupling in price on Amazon. And even if you make the purchase, you could accidentally be snagging <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/30/health/covid-masks-counterfeit-fake.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">counterfeits</a>, which have flooded the market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some politicians don’t think you should pay for N95s at all. Sen. Bernie Sanders, known for his love of covering up, introduced a bill on Tuesday that would give every American three free N95 masks.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOGETHER WITH MONOGRAM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
We’ve Got a Bone to Pick with Orthopedics
</font>
</a>
</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.monogramorthopedics.com/?utm_source=rgamonogramlandingpage&utm_medium=partnership01_01-13" class="">
<img alt="Monogram" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/4866/1641406028-unnamed__1_.png">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, knee and hip replacements can keep joints functioning, <em>buuut</em> there’s still a problem: Complications will cause 10%–15% of those replacements to fail this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Luckily, a solution is coming, courtesy of <a href="https://www.monogramorthopedics.com/?utm_source=rgamonogramlandingpage&utm_medium=partnership01_01-13" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Monogram Orthopedics</a>. Monogram combines 3D printing, specially crafted surgical robots, and AI to create custom implants unique to individual patients. And if your knee-jerk reaction is, “<em>That sounds like solid investment potential,”</em> we’d agree.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The joint-replacement market currently sits at $19.6B, with over 1 million knee replacements performed annually. And with Monogram poised to help overhaul the industry and pave the way for a better future in ortho, make no bones about it: <strong style="color:#000">There’s never been a more fitting time to get in on all this potential.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.monogramorthopedics.com/?utm_source=rgamonogramlandingpage&utm_medium=partnership01_01-13" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This is the final month to invest, so get in before January 27, 2022, here</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/12/key-performance-indicators-january-13?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The top 10 most popular podcasts in the US are on average more than seven years old, and none have made their debut in the past couple of years. Why? Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2022-01-09/podcasting-hasn-t-produced-a-new-hit-in-years?utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=220109&utm_campaign=screentime" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explains</a> that the number of new podcasts is growing faster than the audience, driving down the number of listeners per show.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“All of us at APOPO are feeling the loss of Magawa and we are grateful for the incredible work he’s done.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Belgian nonprofit APOPO, which trains animals to detect land mines and tuberculosis, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/Magawa-land-mine-rat-dead-c34ae88bbf545f7a545c894e16ba2490?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paid its respects</a> to Magawa, an eight-year-old rat who died this week. Magawa was awarded the top award for animal gallantry in 2020 for his work detecting more than 100 land mines and other explosives across a 5-year career.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> Why do so many TV shows and movies look like they were filmed in a gray wasteland? (<a href="https://www.vox.com/culture/22840526/colors-movies-tv-gray-digital-color-sludge?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD & BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gruyere-cheese-court-ruling?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Sorry This Story’s So Cheesy
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gruyere-cheese-court-ruling?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Fondue" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=458 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-12/image-c081d1aeb2ca06f0466c5705a7ae92d229d02d06-480x328-gif/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Fondue" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-12/image-c081d1aeb2ca06f0466c5705a7ae92d229d02d06-480x328-gif/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Val Thorens</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If gruyere doesn’t come from the Gruyeres region of Switzerland, is it just sparkling cheese? A federal judge ruled last week that no, gruyere can be called gruyere whether it’s curdled in the Alps or Wisconsin.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response to a lawsuit from a group of Swiss and French cheesemakers, a Virginia judge concluded that the meaning of gruyere has “eroded” in the US and “rendered it generic.” So despite its 12th century Swiss heritage, the US <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/gruyere-cheese-can-still-called-gruyere-even-not-switzerland-judge-rul-rcna11755?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won’t grant</a> gruyere the international trademark protections afforded to region-specific products like Champagne, Roquefort cheese, and Cognac brandy.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Reactions are hotter than raclette</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The gruyere group behind the suit <a href="https://thetakeout.com/u-s-judge-denies-gruyere-cheese-trademark-protection-1848338295?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans to appeal</a>. A spokesperson for Switzerland's agricultural department said the decision “threatens the reputation of the original product and its place in the foreign market and can only harm the entire sector.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, in the US, the National Milk Producers Federation said it was “ecstatic” about how the case was sliced, while the Dairy Export Council is downright “thrilled.” According to the DEC, European food producers are trying to hoard the entire charcuterie board, with gorgonzola, feta, asiago, and bologna makers all recently seeking international trade protections.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>In our Mini crosswords, you’ll find clues you won’t encounter anywhere else. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/12/brew-crossword-eureka?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play today’s puzzle</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Three Headlines and a Lie</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than anyone who says they got 🟩 🟩 🟩 🟩 🟩 on their first try. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Kanye West wants to </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/marisadellatto/2022/01/11/kanye-west-wants-to-meet-with-vladimir-putin-make-russia-his-second-home/?utm_campaign=forbes&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_term=Gordie&sh=1725aa336745" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meet</a></span><span> with Vladimir Putin, make Russia his ‘second home’</span>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLive Look at Consumer Prices \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A still from the movie Up\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/926f80cb514dde396a171eda62036b2ba2d9c943-1920x1080.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou all selected inflation as the top business story of 2021, and it just kicked off its 2022 campaign with a bang. Consumer prices \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-business-consumer-prices-economy-5f69bed77f98221f9936ae99f96fd361?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoared 7%\u003c/a\u003e in December, marking the largest yearly increase since 1982, the Labor Department reported yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe biggest culprits: \u003c/strong\u003eShelter costs (aka rent) and used car prices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShelter costs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e jumped 0.4% from the previous month and 4.1% on the year—their fastest annual growth since February 2007.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUsed vehicles\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which have become the poster child for the current inflationary environment, have increased 37% over the past year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGasoline prices\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e have also spiked nearly 50% since December 2020, though fuel and energy costs dipped slightly last month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd while many Americans have gotten a raise this year, pay bumps haven’t kept up with price bumps. Real average hourly earnings, or wages that take inflation into account, fell a seasonally adjusted 2.4% in December from a year earlier.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat can be done?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s start with the Fed, whose literal job is to keep prices under control. Caught flat-footed as inflation spread across the economy, the central bank is now planning to wind down its stimulus measures and hike interest rates several times this year. The point is that higher interest rates raise borrowing costs for consumers and businesses, slowing down demand, incentivizing more saving, and in turn deflating prices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOther ideas: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Biden administration has launched an antitrust crusade against highly concentrated industries in the hopes more competition will bring down prices. And the US Chamber of Commerce argued for more immigration to ease labor shortages.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut some analysts argue many of those interventions are like giving Gatorade to a hungover 40 year old—the only fix is to just wait it out. That’s because the Covid-related supply-chain bottlenecks that helped fuel inflation are still raging, and prices will only start to cool when constrained supply catches up with demand.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThose bottlenecks could get even worse. Manufacturing powerhouse China has locked down roughly 20 million people across three cities in a bid to prevent a widespread Omicron outbreak. HSBC economists warned that the Big O gaining steam in Asia, where it hasn’t taken off yet, could lead to the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2022-01-12/supply-chain-latest-china-s-covid-fight-risks-more-supply-turmoil?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emother of all\u003c/a\u003e” supply chain disruptions by forcing factories collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLady Whistledown would have a field day with Boris Johnson’s latest scandal. The UK prime minister \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-europe-london-2b9b4147b1ee8041b341dfce5ef92208?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapologized\u003c/a\u003e yesterday for attending a large outdoor party during Britain's first Covid lockdown in 2020. But his mea culpa did little to douse a political firestorm—officials in every major UK political party, even his own, are urging Johnson to resign.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eOn May 22, 2020, a senior official for Johnson organized a BYOB outdoor garden gathering. Johnson said he only showed up to thank staff for their work throughout the pandemic, so he considered it a “work event.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt that time, UK citizens were only \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-59577129?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eallowed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to meet one other person outside their own household, and they had to be outdoors and remain two meters apart.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo you can probably understand why Brits were so mad to find out politicians were schmoozing among the tulips. The budget airline Ryanair—which isn’t new to trolling the prime minister—let its social media team go hog wild and \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/Ryanair/status/1481238702013796352?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eroast\u003c/a\u003e Johnson with memes so good we thought \u003cem\u003ewe\u003c/em\u003e made them. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eA handful of government officials around the world have treated their own Covid guidelines like they’re a “hand wash only” tag. Last month, for instance, Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin was caught dancing maskless at a club a day after she was in contact with someone who tested positive.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCloth Masks, You Were S’cute\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Kaleidoscope of masks\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e22e9aee0a790ee6dcfafe26fd442d9d92f4a15d-1500x1000.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto Illustration: Dianna \"Mick\" McDougall; Source: Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe CDC could soon change its masking recommendation from “fabric/surgical masks are fine” to “time to stock up on N95s,” the Washington Post reported. The possible switch follows several new studies that suggest cloth \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/n95-mask-protection-covid-958039c9-07f1-45a1-81e7-b7436707fee5.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eisn’t cutting it\u003c/a\u003e anymore.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn one, a well-fit N95 (or other particle-filtering mask) was found to be 75x better at preventing Covid-19 than a surgical mask.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBad news for \u003cem\u003eHey Arnold!\u003c/em\u003e: The most important factor in recent mask studies was how well it fits. People wearing snug N95s were protected against Covid for 2,500 hours if the infected person also wore a fitted N95, versus 25 hours with non-fit-tested N95s.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe growing recognition that N95 \u003e cloth and the possibility of new CDC guidance have caused the prices of N95 and KN95 masks \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-12/n95-kn95-or-cloth-masks-prices-surge-as-cdc-weighs-new-recommendations?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto spike\u003c/a\u003e, with some brands nearly quintupling in price on Amazon. And even if you make the purchase, you could accidentally be snagging \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/30/health/covid-masks-counterfeit-fake.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecounterfeits\u003c/a\u003e, which have flooded the market.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome politicians don’t think you should pay for N95s at all. Sen. Bernie Sanders, known for his love of covering up, introduced a bill on Tuesday that would give every American three free N95 masks.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStat: \u003c/strong\u003eThe top 10 most popular podcasts in the US are on average more than seven years old, and none have made their debut in the past couple of years. Why? Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2022-01-09/podcasting-hasn-t-produced-a-new-hit-in-years?utm_medium=email\u0026utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_term=220109\u0026utm_campaign=screentime\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplains\u003c/a\u003e that the number of new podcasts is growing faster than the audience, driving down the number of listeners per show.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003e“All of us at APOPO are feeling the loss of Magawa and we are grateful for the incredible work he’s done.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Belgian nonprofit APOPO, which trains animals to detect land mines and tuberculosis, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/Magawa-land-mine-rat-dead-c34ae88bbf545f7a545c894e16ba2490?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaid its respects\u003c/a\u003e to Magawa, an eight-year-old rat who died this week. Magawa was awarded the top award for animal gallantry in 2020 for his work detecting more than 100 land mines and other explosives across a 5-year career.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRead:\u003c/strong\u003e Why do so many TV shows and movies look like they were filmed in a gray wasteland? Thorens\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf gruyere doesn’t come from the Gruyeres region of Switzerland, is it just sparkling cheese? A federal judge ruled last week that no, gruyere can be called gruyere whether it’s curdled in the Alps or Wisconsin.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response to a lawsuit from a group of Swiss and French cheesemakers, a Virginia judge concluded that the meaning of gruyere has “eroded” in the US and “rendered it generic.” So despite its 12th century Swiss heritage, the US \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/gruyere-cheese-can-still-called-gruyere-even-not-switzerland-judge-rul-rcna11755?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewon’t grant\u003c/a\u003e gruyere the international trademark protections afforded to region-specific products like Champagne, Roquefort cheese, and Cognac brandy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eReactions are hotter than raclette\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe gruyere group behind the suit \u003ca href=\"https://thetakeout.com/u-s-judge-denies-gruyere-cheese-trademark-protection-1848338295?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplans to appeal\u003c/a\u003e. A spokesperson for Switzerland's agricultural department said the decision “threatens the reputation of the original product and its place in the foreign market and can only harm the entire sector.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, in the US, the National Milk Producers Federation said it was “ecstatic” about how the case was sliced, while the Dairy Export Council is downright “thrilled.” According to the DEC, European food producers are trying to hoard the entire charcuterie board, with gorgonzola, feta, asiago, and bologna makers all recently seeking international trade protections.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
